Author: Emilis#3454
Content: you mean the getbalance call?

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: for example yes

Author: Emilis#3454
Content: that call doesn't really work for me, as with my implementation I'm not going to use the actual wallet on the daemon, but rather provide my privkey where needed (signrawtransaction)

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Emilis are you sure you are running the CLI/RPC against the correct coin?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you must give `-ac_name=COIN`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: or it assumes KMD

Author: Emilis#3454
Content: Yeah, it's on a separate port and getinfo shows the exact correct current height

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I don't fully understand your setup

Author: Emilis#3454
Content: app -> komodod

Author: Emilis#3454
Content: via RPC

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and you say you have an address, which has utxos, confirmed by an explorer

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but local RPC says no utxos?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: also, which explorer. Various kmd pools and maybe some explorers are on forks

Author: Emilis#3454
Content: Yes. This address is not in the wallet.dat, however. I don't know if that would be an issue for listunspent

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, it is

Author: Emilis#3454
Content: Ah, so it has to be one of the wallets in wallet.dat

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: listunspent only tells you about utxos of addresses that the local node has privkey for

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: except for watch-only addresses, which are special

Author: Emilis#3454
Content: Right, right. Thanks 游땎

Author: Emilis#3454
Content: One more thing though

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you could watch the address, then local node could see some stuff

Author: Emilis#3454
Content: I've been biting my head off trying to find docs for this (even on btc docs), but for P2PKH, I don't understand what hash it's supposed to be hashed with. Ripemd160? sha256-double and then ripemd160? Any idea?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: hash160, most likely, that is what all btc address stuff uses

Author: Emilis#3454
Content: Right, thanks 游땎 I'll try that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: use the internal hash160 functions, which is ripemd160(sha256(x)), iirc

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Emilis https://github.com/jl777/komodo/blob/master/src/hash.h#L48

Author: Emilis#3454
Content: Thanks again man

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: 游녨

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: assetchains are runtime forks and their own individual chains, not tokens

Author: psd#8786
Content: Do I need to use the same public and private address?

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
public addys start with R and priv addys start with z
they are different creatures

Author: psd#8786
Content: No, I said is it the same for mainnet and for BEER (or PIZZA)?

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
you can use the same key/addy for any chain, but you have to export/import the key
there is no "central key" that's automatically across all chains without importing

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
```$ komodo-cli -ac_name=BEER getnewaddress
RVVFaexpASLVirWk33je4MU5phZW4JUNyr

$ komodo-cli -ac_name=BEER dumpprivkey RVVFaexpASLVirWk33je4MU5phZW4JUNyr
UuFPD7wAZd8dznn72e46hp6gUfpQANSmsh4XYbUJYFsNjunRFJSB

$ komodo-cli -ac_name=PIZZA importprivkey UuFPD7wAZd8dznn72e46hp6gUfpQANSmsh4XYbUJYFsNjunRFJSB "" true```
Like that, if those were real

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
There is no "mainnet" and "testnet" in Komodo
All chains are live and BEER and PIZZA are assetchains that are used as test chains because they carry the same functionality and will never have any cost/exchange value

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Sorry for asking again. Is there a simple way to get Komodo address(Rxxx...) from pubkey (starts with 02 or 03). I am looking for a script/ RPC call to komodod or marketmaker/A website that has the converter

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: base58(60 & rmd160(sha256(pubkey)))

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but it does seem hard to find. one way is if you think you know the address, validateaddress

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess another way is -pubkey=02.....

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and then make a sendtoaddress transaction. the change will go to the pubkey address.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oh, do any of the <CC>address rpc calls, it will display the various addresses associated with the pubkey

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: yeah thats perfect thanks!

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @gcharang can give you a python script to do it if that helps
